meanings.definition: The rank or title of a marquis.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the character proudly displayed his marquisate to all.
meanings.sent2: The marquisate was bestowed upon him by the king for his bravery in battle.
meanings.sent3: The marquisate decided to throw a grand party to celebrate his new title.
meanings.sent4: Her marquisate shone brightly among the other nobles at the royal ball.
meanings.sent5: The marquisate's elegant attire matched his prestigious title perfectly.

meanings.definition: The territory or jurisdiction of a marquis.
meanings.sent1: The marquisate included vast lands and several villages.
meanings.sent2: The marquisate was known for its fertile fields and bustling markets.
meanings.sent3: The marquisate's borders were constantly patrolled by diligent guards.
meanings.sent4: She ruled her marquisate with a fair and just hand, earning the respect of her subjects.
meanings.sent5: The marquisate's castle stood proudly at the heart of the territory, a symbol of power and authority.
